summary: This module tests the functionality of sm_io_fgets(), verifying file I/O operations work correctly by writing messages to a file and reading them back. It checks various edge cases including empty strings and strings with null characters.

logs.reason: Logs detailed debugging information when the number of characters read doesn't match the expected length. This helps diagnose issues with the sm_io_fgets() function.
logs.resolution: This error indicates a mismatch between expected and actual read lengths. Check if file content was modified externally, if there are encoding issues, or if there's a bug in the sm_io_fgets implementation.

logs.reason: Identifies the start of the test suite for the fget functionality. This message is used by the testing framework to organize test results.
logs.resolution: This is an informational log, no resolution required.

logs.reason: Provides version identification information for the module within the codebase.
logs.resolution: This is an informational string for version tracking, no resolution required.
